img.alt: Crime Fiction Awards: The Best in Mysteries, Suspense Novels and Thrillers
img.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px; border: 0px none transparent; width: 100%; max-width: 100%; height: auto;
img.title: Crime Fiction Awards: The Best in Mysteries, Suspense Novels and Thrillers

p.style: text-align: center; margin: 12px auto; padding: 0px auto; border: 0px none transparent; clear: both;
font-style: italic; color: #ac7f1f; font-weight: bold; margin-bottom: 12px;

td.p:
The Agatha Awards honor the traditional mystery — books best typified by the works of Agatha Christie — and are awarded annually by Malice Domestic, Ltd. Winners are chosen by attendees of the annual Malice Domestic convention.
In 1994, the organization began awarding grants to authors of unpublished mysteries.

ul.li: Best Contemporary Novel: Long Upon the Land by Margaret Maron (Grand Central)
Best First Novel: On the Road with Del and Louise by Art Taylor (Henery Press)
Best Non-Fiction: The Golden Age of Murder by Martin Edwwards (HarperCollins)

td.p:
If present,
indicates a review by Mysterious Reviews .
